title: Viktor Maslov (mathematician)
summary: Viktor Pavlovich Maslov (Russian: Виктор Павлович Маслов; born 15 June 1930, in Moscow) is a Russian mathematical physicist. He is a member of the Russian Academy of Sciences. He obtained his doctorate in physico-mathematical sciences in 1957.[2]  His main fields of interest are quantum theory, idempotent analysis, non-commutative analysis, superfluidity, superconductivity, and phase transitions. He is editor-in-chief of Mathematical Notes and Russian Journal of Mathematical Physics.
